google_play_reviews.content: Very useful in keeping you informed about your repos. Its not a replacement for the github website of course. I use it for many years to keep track of commits my teammates push, comment on issues etc. Simpel and stable app with no ads or excessive permissions.
best
Used to work well, but now it silently fails when I update issues on a repository
Text wrapping doesn't work when viewing source code.
Does exactly what it needs to do
This crashes everytime I try to open a PR
Best GitHub app so far, includes support for issues, milestone filtering and project support. Pretty robust actually and very fast.
Very fast, smooth, user interactive, logically persistent across navigations, simple (neat) github client app, also compaired to peer apps.

Slow and clunky. Direct web access is cleaner and more intuitive. Just getting to any project's readme. md is clicky and slow. The app is missing lots of features natively found on the web interface like for instance pull requests, releases and issues.
I been lost from too much of everything at one time but slowly getting there and thanks couldn't done it with out everyone's help on the app and github and many more
Awesome 👌
does what it says on the tin
usefully and authentic app
Marvelous client. Everything is top.

To the peep holes...who saved files of mines and took all my rel i identify ... don't you think you got what you want.. i dont think its cool 4 2 of you to keep browsing around when pretty much i have nothing for you to keep taking from me..4 2 of you build you program and move on... the world is better with open arm and a big bundle of joy..
Does what I need.
Awesome little app that allows me to keep an eye on my github on the move.been using it for years highly recommend
My main purpose was able to check on commits in different repos, including my company. This one was the only one I tried that made my life simple. Thanks!
is a fork of official unmaintained app, and do all the things I need :) ps: works with 2 step authentication
Very well designed and easy to use. I use it often to check what's happening in my project.

I've found this app to be invaluable for on-the-fly Git-ing. Thanks

OP
Perfect for what I need to achieve in my projects.
Nice app for browsing and checking projects on GitHub. Love it.
Very useful, but can be slow when loading branches/tags
Good GitHub client. Great for quick responses to issues.

You really rock!I do a lot of reviewing of my repos via your app, especially reorganizing some issues into milestones. But I would love to sort issues by milestones so that they show up sorted in collapsible milestone lists. That would help me to scroll through my milestones one after the other to get an overview of them all. Other than that, everything works really well! Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: Best GitHub android client :)
Навигация некорректная

The app is view only. In short you can log into your git hub account from this app and see what else you see in the browser but you can't edit or commit anything, even less functionality than the browser. I'm giving it 4 stars just for the ease of access and better view than the mobile site of github and it really smooth at its work.
Love the app! If there was any way to edit files it'd be perfect.
Great app.
Great app
Thanks so much! Been using it for long time.
Useful
Good app!
This is the best GitHub app I've found. It just works and gets me around efficiently and fast. Look no further for a GitHub client.
Unwieldy if you have too many repos, but otherwise an excellent client.
Great productivity tool. It's no GitHub Web, but who wants that in <6"? It supports organisations, and I now get a lot of code reviews done on my commute, and I have ForkHub to thank!
I like it.
The app doesn't seem OAuth.  That's a non-starter.  The personal access token bit is better than nothing, but still too clunky (vs. OAuth).
Works perfectly. Kudos
Please fix freezing when loading large files

This is the best of the github apps I tried.  Still could use some improvements though.  For instance, it would be nice if when I click on a commit referenced from an issue, it actually linked to the commit so I could view it.  Also, I'd like to be able to sort issues by recent activity.  Still, when I'm not on my computer, this app works better than the web site for checking recent github activity.  So I appreciate you making it.  Thank you.  Update: The latest version has added quite a few nice features, including my above requests.  It also has a smoother feel to the navigation than it used to.  Upgrading my rating to 5 stars.   :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
I think all you request are working on the latest release.

Thanks for the feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: The app let you check everything from github, to keep track of your branches and repositories. Fast and easy

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please create issues with your ideas for improvement so we can help: https://github.com/jonan/ForkHub/issues

google_play_reviews.content: While it's true this app is a successor to the old abandoned official Github app this one also lacks much needed support for managing Pull Requests unless I missed something. Without PR support to me it really only tapped into a minor part of it's full potential. Once PRs are fully supported I am more than happy to award it its fully deserved 5 star rating. Until such a time sadly a 4 star rating it only is. Edit: Weird, screenshots show what looks like PR support but unable to find such feature in the app. Some help, please.

google_play_reviews.content: A very smooth app and has a very good UI. Far better than other github apps.

You can create a token yourself https://github.com/settings/tokens and use it as password in the app.

google_play_reviews.content: I only give 5 to perfect apps, but I wish I could give this a 4.5 or something. Great design, simple to the point, the only things I've noticed is notifications come in a few to several minutes late (could just be my connection, don't know for sure) and the login screen says "Username or E-Mail". I can't login with just the username, I have to login with my E-mail. Not a bad thing, just misleading. But otherwise, it's great and am glad to see a mobile app for github that actually works. Keep it up.
